p: Currently, the greatest concern with breastfeeding lies in the possibility of infants being contaminated by the mothersâ€™ respiratory droplets ( 33, 38) . To decrease this risk, mothers are recommended to wear surgical masks during breastfeeding to protect against coughing or sneezing, in addition to constantly performing proper hand hygiene. If mothers opt not to breastfeed while the symptoms remain, health workers should encourage them to pump breast milk and allow another caregiver, who lives in the same home, to feed the infant ( 23, 28, 38, 52) .
